intro: Aglaonema marantifolium var. commutatum, commonly known as the silver queen plant, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, variegated foliage with white and green patterns on its broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in low-light conditions and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its leaves are glossy and can grow up to 12 inches in length, adding a decorative touch to any space. It is also known for its air-purifying qualities, contributing to its popularity as a houseplant.
